Share images with scrambled Exif via
Request permission
Scrambled Exif needs access to your files to read the images you share with it.\n\nPlease tap on the button below to grant the necessary permission.
Instructions
Select the pictures you wish to share from your gallery and tap on the share icon.
Select Scrambled Exif from the app list.
At this point, the metadata is being deleted!
Once this is done, the app list appears again. Just share the pictures like you normally would.

Privacy Policy
Settings
Rename images
Filenames can tell a recipient of the file the date and time that a photo was taken on some devices.\n\nThis option renames all shared images with a random filename.
Keep orientation
This \"physically\" rotates the image according to the EXIF data in the original image.\n\nThis takes a little longer.
Logging
Enable logging
Write logs to app\'s cache directory. On non-rooted devices, only Scrambled Exif should be able to access these logs. You can send them to the dev using the option below.
Send logs to dev
Perhaps he\'ll be able to help :)
Panic Button Settings
Panic Button
With the following settings you can configure how Scrambled Exif reacts to an external panic button app (e.g. Ripple) trigger.
Delete cached images
Once the images have been shared, these are safe to delete (a clean-up happens periodically anyway).
Clear app data
Delete cached images and settings. Also kill app and remove from recently used.
